headline: Chicken Milano
description: A delicious pasta and chicken dish with garlic, sun-dried tomatoes and fresh basil. Serve with crusty bread.

video.description: See how to make a tasty Italian-influenced chicken dish.
video.name: Chicken Milano

name: Chicken Milano
recipeIngredient: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: In a large saucepan over low heat, melt butter; add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and 3/4 cup of the chicken broth; increase to medium heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for about 10 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender. Add the cream and bring to a boil; stirring. Simmer over medium heat until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.

Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper on both sides. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm oil and saute chicken. Press on chicken occasionally with a slotted spatula. Cook for about 4 minutes per side or until the meat feels springy and is no longer pink inside. Transfer to a board; cover and keep warm. Discard the fat from the skillet.
In the same skillet, over medium heat, bring 1/4 cup chicken broth to a boil; stirring the pan juices. Reduce slightly and add to the cream sauce; stir in basil and adjust seasonings to taste.
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add fettuccine and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain, transfer to a bowl and toss with 3 to 4 tablespoons of the sauce.
Cut each chicken breast into 2 to 3 diagonal slices. Reheat the sauce gently if needed. Transfer the pasta to serving plates; top with chicken and coat with the cream sauce; serve.

review.reviewBody: Awesome
This was soooooo good!
Served over spaghetti squash. Delicious!

Recipe is bland, made it a second time and much better. Add more garlic to at least 4-6 Cloves minced. Reduce sauce considerably, to coats a spoon significantly Use chicken thighs instead of breasts! Breasts come out dry and tasteless Deglaze pan with only 2 tablespoons of chicken broth not a 1/4 cup, and reduce to half. Basil adds very little to this dish other than color
Delicious! Maybe needs a bit more salt.

My daughter made this the first time about 2 years ago. The only thing she does different is she slices the chicken breast then pan fries them as tenders instead of cooking them whole. Whenever she offers to make dinner this is what we request! We eat it over jasmine rice instead of pasta.

This dish is fantastic!! Used sun dried tomatoes in oil like I usually do and it was great. I saved the oil for another pasta dish. This definitely looks and taste like a fine dining dinner. Will make again.

Let me just tell you I was completely impressed with this meal I made it for my father and myself it was simple easy gorgeous I couldn’t believe I made it. It literally looked like something I would buy in a restaurant and it was very good. I am now going to make it for my family !! I can’t wait- you can’t go wrong with this recipe
Rich in flavor! Stick to the recipe, plain and simple. DON'T overcook the chicken. Pull and foil at 160. I always double up the sauce, this allowing to dip the homemade garlic bread in!
Absolutely delicious!!! Made this exactly as recipe stated. Very easy.
Super easy and tasty. I threw some parmesan cheese on top to give it a little extra flavor.

I used only 2 chicken breasts and the full sauce recipe, I still would have liked a bit more sauce. The flavors were good, I added some onion and mushrooms to the sauteed chicken breasts and also some white wine to the 1/4 c. chicken broth and reduced them before adding to the creamed sauce mixture. I would make this again.
5 star!

This was an outstanding recipe. Both my husband and I agreed it was restaurant quality and I will surely make it again. The only changes I made were: I added some sliced mushrooms because I needed to use them up, I mixed in one tablespoon of flour as a thickener and used only one third cup of heavy cream because that was all I had left and it was just for the two of us. Thank you so much for a delicious recipe.
Excellent recipe. A keeper for sure! Thank you for sharing.
This recipe is simply divine. The whole family loved it. I added some onions with the garlic just to add some body to the sauce but other than that, i stuck to the recipe.
This is one of my favorite dishes and my three young children love it too!
I made this with fresh parsley as I did not have basil and it was delicious. Easy to make, will definitely make this a regular meal.
I browned the chicken and finished cooking in the sauce. But I was making it for a big crowd and that made it easier to serve.
Great recipe.
This dish is delicious and the sauce could be eaten with a spoon
Excellent! The only substitution I made was for the heavy cream. I used non fat milk and butter. Will be making this again!
I loved this recipe! My hubs said it tasted like something from a fine Italian restaurant. The only thing I would do differently next time is to double the sauce. We like lots of sauce on our pasta.

Yes I made this dish for Christmas dinner. Per the recipe it turned out perfect. The sauce is definitely the star in this dish. The recipe was pretty simple and economical. We totally enjoyed this dish.

Excellent recipe. I used some of cookiqueen's recommendations modified a bit.
-Chicken in milk with 1 TBSP white vinegar for a couple hours.
-Cut into strips and dredged in 1/2 cup flour, 1 TBSP smoke paprika, salt and pepper. Fry in 2 TBSP grape seed oil and 2 TBSP butter then set aside and keep warm. By removing the chicken until plating, it remains crispy and keeps the flavors of the smoked paprika.
-Saute garlic for a minute, add sundried tomatoes (1/2 minute) then deglaze pan with 1 cup chicken broth.
-Add 3/4 cups Chablis (or another white wine). Cover (lid ajar to allow reduction) and simmer for 20 minutes.
-Turn heat off to avoid curdling cream. Add 1 1/2 cup cream (I used half and half). Add 2 TBSP cornstarch mixed with 1+ TBSP water. Turn heat back on to just a simmer, uncovered, for about 10 minutes while stirring to thicken.
-Add basil right before serving.
I tossed the fettuccine with 2 ladles of sauce. Plated the fettuccine, laid strips of chicken on top then added more sauce.
Thanks to those that commented with great suggestions. Really helped make a very good recipe even better. Wish I had made more chicken as everyone wanted more.
Definitely had to add some more seasonings but holy COW!!! This is a new regular in my house!

Made this for the first time last night and it was just as good as everyone says. Fairly easy to throw together, too. I cooked the chicken first and removed it, then just made the sauce in that pan. I wanted more sauce too, so I just added more broth and cream until I had enough, and adjusted seasoning along the way. Delicious!

This was really good! I cooked the chicken first and then melted the butter and sautéed the garlic in the same pan as the chicken using the broth to deglaze the pan. It turned out great. I tripled the recipe and it was enough for 8 hungry firefighters.

Omg so yum! I used herb infused sun dried tomatoes, which gave it an extra level of flavor. I doubled the ingredients bc I cook for 4 (my boyfriend, myself and 2 teenage boys). It was a hit with all of them the boys being picky eaters. I would definitely make this one again!!!
Tasted like it cane out of an Italian restaurant's cucina! I added more garlic and fresh parsley. Well recommended!
Good. If using sun-dried tomato’s from a jar, rinse them otherwise the dish comes out to oily.

I've made this multiple times now...made exactly as is or with variations depending on ingredients on-hand. Everytime it turns out delicious! Don't be afraid to make it your own. Today I made it using shrimps and regular tomatoes (no sun-dried) great turn out! One thing I will say is important to have is..fresh basil. This will make a huge difference in making this dish special.

This recipe is great, I did like the rest of the reviews and used one pan and I added mushrooms and Parmesan cheese about a 1/2 cup. Definitely tasted like something I would have ordered at a restaurant.
Absolutely amazing recipe ty!!
Very flavorful. Followed the recipe as written and used fresh basil from the garden. Cant wait for left overs tomorrow!
This was wonderful!

Even my picky daughter liked this. I had no heavy cream, so used sour cream and a little milk; and no sun-dried tomatoes, so I seeded a couple roma tomatoes diced them small. I'm sure it was more tangy than the original recipe but it was a successful substitution.
Not bad . My husband wasn't a fan . Just wasn't his thing . I myself enjoyed it.

I made this last night for dinner. It was a big hit. I used the all the ingredients as called for in the recipe. The only thing I did different was cooked the chicken and then made the sauce instead of making the sauce, then cooking the chicken, then adding the sauce back to the same pan.

Love this recipe. So easy. The only thing I changed was the sauce. I added parsley, balsamic vinegar, honey and whiskey. You won’t regret it. Also, there isn’t much for veggies in this, but you can add them. I cooked peppers in with the chicken. As a side, I had a spinach salad with feta and cherry tomatoes.
Wonderful flavors and my family loved it!
I loved this dish! So good!
Absolutely delicious, and so simple to make. This has become a staple in our house.
Added parmesan cheese to the sauce, and combined the pasta and chicken with the sauce in the pan.

This dish is great. The only thing I did was added more garlic because we like garlic but it was very tasty. I will increase the amounts for step 1 next time because I really love the sauce but it’s great the way it’s written as well. To each is own, so make it your way. Maybe sprinkle some fresh basil on the top to offset the colors a bit and make it pop.

Very tasty. My wife is not a tomato fan, but she enjoyed it. 
I didn’t follow “steps”. Rather, I had three burners going at once and it turned out fine.

Delicious. The sauce wasn't quite as thick as I would have expected or liked, but that wasn't a bad thing. Overall great meal. I added mushrooms onions and bell peppers to the mix. Sauted them in a cast iron skillet with olive oil and garlic, set aside and cooked the chicken in that pan. When chicken was done I didn't remove it as the recipe called for, I left it in and added the broth then sauce. (maybe thats why it didnt quite thicken up but i felt it was easier, faster, and made for less dishes)

This was fantastic, we all loved it! Changes: I doubled the sauce and will use the extra for a mushroom ravioli. I added fresh mushrooms, and added a little white wine and parmesan cheese to the cream sauce.
Excellent dish.
Was a tasty dish. Added a bit more sun dried tomatoes and would do a quarter more of the sauce for extra saucy pasta. Overall, easy to make and my family really liked it. Would make again.
I make this dish all the time. Did it with gulf shrimp we brought back from Alabama. We added spinach and fresh tomatoes. Lemon pepper to taste. Awesome! Even better next day!
Note to self: don’t double the sauce, just halve the chicken. Otherwise, use top-rated modification. Came out runny and oily but tasted wonderful.

This recipe is amazing! My entire family loves it. I highly recommend! It’s easy and fairly quick to put together. I have been growing fresh basil and used it. I’m not sure how much impact the fresh has over dried but yum!
This was a huge hit for the whole family. My toddler even loved it as well. I did make double sauce bc the initial amount wouldn’t have been enough. Will
Delicious and quite simple to make! I doubled the amount of chicken, noodles and sauce but used slightly less than 1/2 of tomatoes. Big eaters in my family!
Perfect! It tastes and smells soo good! I just added some shredded cheese on top!
This was great! Easy and delicious. The only thing I did different was marinade the chicken in Italian dressing then grilled it.
Family loved it!!! Substituted portobello mushrooms for sun dried tomatoes.
Only change I made was adding a few fresh mushrooms to the sauce. Absolutely DELICIOUS!
This dish was delicious!!!! But then I love anything with sun dried tomatoes. I only had half and half so added a sprinkle of corn starch to thicken it. Will be making this many more times.
This dish was delicious!!!! But then I love anything with sun dried tomatoes. I only had half and half so added a sprinkle of corn starch to thicken it. Will be making this many more times.

I made this with the exact ingredients stated and it was very delicious. My family loved it and my son had a second helping. I will say that my son doesn’t like tomatoes, so I had to think up a way to disguise them. I got the blender out and puréed the tomatoes with the 3/4 cup of broth and told him it was a red pepper sauce. He complimented how great the dish was....(our secret on the tomatoes). The amount of the sauce was perfect for the amount of the pasta. Sorry, we had almost finished our meal before I realized I didn’t get a pic. I will be making this dish again and again and again.
This is an easy and very very delicious recipe! My entire family loved it...kids, too! We used fresh baby tomatoes instead of sun dried, and I also added kale. Delish!

Great flavor. Added more liquid as not enough for the quantity of pasta I made but delicious. I took another reviewer’s advise and floured the chicken with Salt, pepper paprika before frying. Fabulous !
Very good! I followed other reviewers and made it a one skillet recipe, doubled the sauce and added mushrooms and asparagus.
Absolutely amazing! My family loved it and has said I must make it again.
Loved this simple and delicious dish!!

Excellent recipe! Be careful not to make it too salty. I used chicken cutlets so they were thinner, added white wine with the chicken broth and mushrooms. I also cooked the chicken and sauce all in one sauce pan.

This tased great! I used the ingredients called for in the recipe except I had to use sun-dried tomatoes in oil and dried basil. My sauce was a little oily so next time I'll try to get the sun-dried tomatoes that are not in oil. Thanks again for this tasty recipe.
I did not have the cream so I used greek yogurt which I believe had an impact on the quality of the final result.
love this recipe. I only substituted fat free half and half for the heavy whipping cream. thickened it with cornstarch paste.... delicious recipe
Made it with Penne, and added mushrooms but GREAT recipe!
This was great will definitely be making again. I add mushrooms and a little Parmesan cheese to the sauce. Other than that recipe was great.
One of my family’s favorites. It’s the closest I can get to one of our favorite Italian restaurants dishes. I make extra sauce just to throw over pasta for lunch the next day. So tasty!
Double the sauce, add yellow onion before the garlic and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese at the end. This is the best dish ever. Everyone asks me for the recipe!
I find the recipe, as posted, is a bit light on the sauce, so I ALWAYS double the ingredients for the sauce. It is absolutely amazing. Another go-to recipe when we host dinner.
Oh my this is AMAZING!!!
Delish recipe as is! But like other reviewers I made it all in one pan.
this was really good! the sauce was terrific! very creamy. I did add a bit of white wine to deglaze the pan but otherwise stuck to the recipe. I will definitely make this again!

I have made this a few times now and we always enjoy it. I cant remember if I have reviewed this before but the time before this i followed others’ advice and used less pans and honestly we didn’t like it as well. The extra pan worked for me. My husband doesn’t usually like cream sauces but he loves this! The only difference is I used just regular cream - not heavy as that is what I-had.
very easy. followed exact. will make it again.

Really quick and easy recipe that turned out a lot better than I expected. I replaced heavy cream with coconut milk and butter with olive oil, but otherwise followed the directions as is. It came out really creamy and savory, with a bursts of sweetness from the tomato. After having a little, I decided to up the acidity and added some kalamata olives. This really kicked it up for me, especially with some of the olive juice added to the sauce, and I plan on making again in the future when I have some sun dried tomatoes I need to use up.
Absolutely delicious! I’ve made this as is a few times and we love it. Do yourself a favor and double the sauce!
Amazing!! Served over jasmine rice. Pefect with using the sundried tomatoes in a jar. May add more garlic and some red pepper flakes.
This is that one meal that I always eat way too much of when I make it. Can't get enough!!
Simple recipe and came out amazing! The sun dried tomatoes really set this off. I paired this with a slightly chilled Viognier. Beautiful meal!
This was super tasty, I'll be adding a finely chopped shallot and some thin sliced mushrooms from here on out.

The taste was amazing, but the thickness of the noodle subtracted from that. Should try again with penne or spaghetti.

Enjoyed with fresh green beans and homemade garlic bread. Very enjoyable altogether.
This was absolutely delish!! Not difficult to make. I didn’t even add salt and to give it a kick I added red pepper flakes. Will definitely make it again. It was a hit
A lot of work but tasty restaurant quality!

Excellent flavor! The amount of sauce is plenty for this dish. My wife & I love garlic so I used 4 cloves instead of 2 and I also added garlic powder to the chicken breasts as they cooked. Other than that I made it as per the recipe.
Olive Garden -not that great.
This is a great recipe. However, for leftovers, I poured it over white rice instead of the noodles, and I thought it was even better.
Amazing flavor. Simple to prepare. Restaurant quality
Wonderful, even better the next day! Only addition I made was 3 strips of thick, hickory smoked bacon, chopped then browned before cooking the chicken in the same pan.

I made this exactly as written, no dredging chicken in flour or making twice as much sauce or thickening the sauce with cornstarch. The chicken was very tender, the sauce was not too heavy and overall it was very tasty. I will definitely make it again but I think it may need a little something extra next time. The rave reviews are warranted unless it has been so modified it’s not the same recipe. But adding a little white wine or red pepper flakes may be all it needs. I highly recommend following it as written at least the first time you make it.
Made it with beef broth instead of chicken broth, probably screwed it up by doing that: it definitely tasted like beef.

This recipe is top notch and super delish! Try Better Than Bouillon instead of regular chicken broth although not entirely necessary because this recipe has plenty of flavor. I did like the idea of adding paprika to the flour before dredging the chicken. Also definitely double the sauce. In fact, double your whole recipe so you’ll have leftovers for lunch tomorrow!

My daughter told me this is one of her favorite meals the first time I made it. I made it a second time for family and they all said how exceptional it was. Definately double up on the sauce if you like to dip your bread! It's too good not to!
